personality development skills episode 3
presentation skills share is indeed
worth 1000 words but it must be a good
one written by David Leeds the material
how much you know or what skills you
possess unless you presented 12 what
people see is what people think if you
present yourself and what you have to
say well you project yourself as a good
personality
a king before the audience is an
opportunity provided to the speaker to
express their point of view making a
presentation in front of a large
audience is not all that difficult if a
few factors are kept in mind slee
maintain a positive attitude it reflects
on your face and in the confidence
levels your body language and
communication should come across as
assertive a positive attitude enhances
your skills and boosts your confidence
level level of participation of the
audience depends on the body language
and voice modulation of the speaker
which accounts to as much as 93 percent
the content is mere 7% though you have
an excellent content but if your body
language is not appropriate or open the
efficiency of the presentation comes
down drastically but if the speaker is
able to carry off both voice inflection
and body language well the audience will
automatically pay greater attention to
the content aerial to be presented it is
the first stage of giving a presentation
it is always better to prepare for
material more than what is thought
necessary once this is ready it needs to
be given a structure to what should come
first
what should follow next and so on and so
forth the objective is to present the
topic in such a manner that the points
are clearly comprehensible
never memorize the content because it
can pressurize the mind and a slip or a
mistake at any one point can break the
chain and prove disaster s instead
understand the presentation and the flow
you can make a paper cheat sheet or cue
cards with important points that link to
the presentation to help you remember
always number your cue cards follow the
rule of three which says people tend to
remember list of three things like a b c
or one two three so structure your
speech around groups of three points
each and not more than three groups it
will be easier for your audience to
absorb what you're saying and you will
be an instant hit always make the
purpose of the presentation to your
audience at the very start first tell
them what you want to tell them through
the presentation and finally tell them
what you told them throughout the
presentation always conclude your
presentation at the end for example if
your topic is components of the solar
system at the start tell your audience
that you'll be talking about what is the
solar system made up of etc then present
your content and to conclude summarize
your presentation and put a cross once
you finish ask your audience if they
have any question this will make the
session more interactive and complete
the chain the self projection once the
content is ready it is important to
exercise self-control if you are nervous
stop and breathe deep it will help you
relax synchronize your body language
with your ideas also dress comfortably
it is very important that you dress
appropriately and comfortably while
addressing a crowd as they tend to judge
you in the
first ten seconds also because if you're
not comfortable with what you're wearing
it will distract your attention and you
might end up blanking out onstage the
body language once you're comfortable
pay attention to other factors maintain
a steady eye contact with the audience
which would portray that you are
confident about what you're presenting
do not shuffle on the stage it will be
distracting for the audience and makes
it hard to follow what you have to say
project a simple straight and a
confident posture and always maintain a
good smile check on the following points
before you start your presentation are
you dressed in accordance with the
situation is your content ready are you
confident about presenting it to your
visual aids enhance your presentation
are they bold clear and simple will they
be visible to each member in the
audience are they numbered in order are
you equipped with other materials like
marker dust for etc have you timed your
presentation do you have an alternate
plan having a check on the above points
will never make you panic and your
presentation will be a success
